course.subject: MARK
course.name: Global Marketing
course.description: Understanding the formulation of international/multinational marketing strategy; factors influencing international trade, assessment of market potential, threats and opportunities in the international market environment, global marketing activities.

reviews.author: hhhh_
reviews.comment_content:
Interesting topics

Module 1. Global Marketing Introduction
Module 2. The Cultural Environment
Module 3. The Legal/ Political Environment
Module 4. Global Segmentation and Positioning
Module 5. Entry Strategies
Module 6. Marketing Strategies for Emerging Markets
Module 7. Global Product Strategies
Module 8. Global Product & Brand Management
Module 9. Global Distribution
Module 10. Global Communication Strategies
Module 11. Global Pricing
Module 12. Sustainability and Global Management
reviews.comment_teaching:
He is passionate and willing to listen to students' sharing.

Tutorials are given and were not mandatory. But, if you attend, you will definitely give a good impression to the professor since not many students were attending.
reviews.comment_grading:
Good grading! Almost everyone in our group received an A range.
It is important to choose good group members. Also, I recommend you talk with the professor after class to discuss the possible project direction.
reviews.comment_workload: Moderate workload. You will be required to watch some pre-recorded videos.

reviews.author: yauyaulok
reviews.title: Pretty good grade course
reviews.comment_content:
1. Global Marketing Environment
- Culture Environment
- Legal/ Political Environment

2. Global Marketing Strategy
- Entry Strategies
- Global Segment/ Positioning
- Marketing Stratgies for Emerging Market

3. Global Marketing Mix
- Global Brand Management
- Global Distribution
- Global Communications Stratgies
- Global Pricing
reviews.comment_teaching: Kristiaan is a good prof! Leng grade and always raise questions for student to gain parti. Be more active and he will remember your face and always pick you for answering questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Class participation 13%
Individual Research credit 2%
Quiz 30%
Online quizzes 5%
Individual case assignment 5%  
Group assignments 10%
Group project 35% (include interim report, presentation, final report)

Total 100%  

Me:
Active participation, Mid-term (Quiz) mean, Online quizzes full marks, Individual Assigment mean, Group Assigment mean, Group project above mean,

Overall A
reviews.comment_workload: Workload is heavy. Small quiz on canvas every week. Need to watch his lecture videos uploaded on canvas to complete his quiz. Every week have 2 reading materials and need tp prepare before class. Still have Mid-term, Final, Presentation, Report, assignment....

reviews.author: oldbiscuit
reviews.title: Interesting course
reviews.comment_content:
1. the global marketing environment
- cultural environment
- legal/political environment
2. global marketing strategy
- global segmentation and positioning
- entry strategies
- marketing opportunity assessment
- marketing strategies for emerging markets
3. global marketing mix
- global product strategies: new product development
- the internet and the global marketplace
- global brand management
- global distribution
- global communication strategies
- global pricing
- sustainability and global marketing
reviews.comment_teaching:
Very interesting mixed mode, technically only one lecture per week + case review session + videos

Especially like the Tesla video professor recorded, and all the product examples he brought to class
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading for the exams was confusing, the final exam was graded by a PG and the grading criteria wasn't clear. It was difficult to understand how they regard the "right" answer.

Grading for the project (reports and presentations): not hard to get a good grade but the grade difference between groups was very small
reviews.comment_workload: Usually, you'll have to submit an assignment after the lecture session, which is a case discussion during class and you just have to consolidate the answers and submit that night

reviews.author: omelettepls
reviews.comment_content: The marketing topics covered are quite interesting because it is about the global market rather than just local context.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching style feel alright for me. It is not to dry like other lectures and gave a lot of example too.
reviews.comment_grading: It is not disclose so it is hard to tell how well you did.
reviews.comment_workload: Have to stay consistent if not it will be very hard to keep up with the topics covered because there are quizzes every week. Have to revise regularly if you want to score good grades.

reviews.author: ET00
reviews.title: Intense and just bs
reviews.comment_content:
Basically just the normal 4P stuff but making them seem professionally global.
Refer to other course reviews for details.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Lectures are fine, because most of the time it's just students answering the discussion questions. However, remember to find a good seat because he will often neglect the hands behind him.
For online lectures, the video content was quite repetitive imo.
For the project, very minimum guidance was given.
Also they claimed that attendance was not required in one of the lecture but the TA would still pass the attendance sheet around. Why is this ;)
reviews.comment_grading: No scores released for final. No paper checking session. Do not even know where are the possible mistakes. I personally find this quite unfair, because there are essay parts in the exam. Although we were asked to write point form for the exam, I could clearly hear and quickly peek that some students were still writing very long essays.
reviews.comment_workload: Can you imagine reading 2 cases + attend usual lectures + watching extra online lectures + online quiz every week??? Plus during lecture you need to keep raising hand to answer questions??? This is the heaviest workload course among all the mark courses I have ever studied

reviews.author: pakapika
reviews.title: good!
reviews.comment_content:
Expect that it will be super intensive
back then, there were over 20 people (out of 50) raising their hand to answer the professor's questions lol
but I mean this was fun because I get to understand the topics and am able to interact more with the professor!
bet that's the key to score higher when the professor can remember you
reviews.comment_grading:
1. Class Participation (13%).
2. Take-home quiz (25%).
3. Individual case assignment (10%).
4. Online quizzes (5%).
5. Group Assignments (15%).
6. Team Project (30%):
reviews.comment_workload:
you just have to attend lecture once weekly
the remaining are just online lecture videos

reviews.author: duh.
reviews.comment_content:
As mentioned in the course title, you will know more about how marketing works on an international level. You will understand different frameworks and strategies that are important to successful global marketing, and they will be explained clearly with various examples and case studies by the professor.

Blended learning is adopted in this course:
- Online learning: Main contents were taught via video on Canvas which elaborate on the content on lecture notes; there were very short MC quizzes for each chapter too.
- F2F lecture (once a week): Case studies are the main topic in F2F lectures. You will need to be prepared since professor will ask questions and your opinion about them during f2f lectures. The classes will be wrapped up in a short conclusion with takeaways.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professor is quite engaging as he often asked us questions and opinions regarding case studies. And it was quite fun when professor shared his own personal experience or interacted with exchange students who come from/have visited certain countries that are covered in the cases. He is also very responsive as he gave answers and suggestions via emails quickly even during non-lecture days. Also, he always looked excited during teaching so that's quite fun and enjoyable.

He has a very obvious european accent. While a previous review and one of my classmate addressed difficulty in understanding what he was saying, it was a small problem to me. Despite his accent, his pronunciation was clear, his use of word was simple and he was loud, so he was quite comprehensible to me.
reviews.comment_grading:
Course assessment:
Class participation 13%
Individual Research 2%
Mid-term+Final 35%
Individual Online quizzes 5%
Group assignments 15%
Team Project 30%
-Interim report (5%)
-Presentation (10%)
-Final report (15%)

IMO, attendance is very crucial to grading since it affects class participation and group assignments which ask questions about the cases during F2F lectures. Class participation is easy to get as professor has many trivial questions to ask about the cases. So don't feel shy to speak up.

Canvas quizzes and midterms (all MCs) are easy, but the final exam (few MCs, short Qs and short essay Qs) was way more difficult since good memory was no longer enough; it's about comprehension, analysis, and even creativity.

Overall, grading is fair.
reviews.comment_workload:
There are a project(report+presentation), a mid-term, and a final. So typical marketing course workload.

While preparing for both main contents and case studies every week sounds hard, it's not. The lectures mainly focuses on case studies which take around 10 minutes to read (I often skip the background part), and the questions professor asked rarely covered the main content. So I only studied lecture notes when I was free or exams were close (riskier for exams tho).

reviews.author: strawberry cake
reviews.comment_teaching:
New teaching style: blended learning
you have to watch the lecture video on canvas every week and do a few MC question (you can google the answers XD). there is only 1 lesson every week used as a case study discussion
reviews.comment_grading:
13% class participation, it is important that you share your views in class regarding the case study
the quizzes are easy, nothing tricky
reviews.comment_workload:
Case Study every week
Project: interim report + presentation (no written report), it is about the expansion plan / marketing proposal of a brand to 2 brand new markets
2 Quizzes, no final exam: MC for quiz 1 and short questions for Quiz 2

reviews.author: kjchan Jenny
reviews.title: Global Marketing
reviews.comment_content: Overall, the teaching is great though the workload is heavy, and the grading is fair. You will expect to put effort for this class, and I believe you will improve your case analyzing skills by this course, and really learn something. However, if you aim to get high grades without working, that is basically impossible for this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: The teaching is easy to follow and understandable. The professor gives a lot of examples, and understandable accent. I don't fall asleep in class.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say the grading was fair as it based on class participation, assignment, and quizzes. The professor does care a lot about the quality of participation in class. For group presentation, if you show great presentation skill and proper logical thinking of explaining the cases or the local company you selected. I will say overall earning an A is hard but not impossible.

Textbook is useful if you do not understand the key terms, but the practice question is most helpful for exams.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of the course includes a lot of case study and you will have to place enough time for each task outside of class to discuss and formulate the report.

reviews.author: dandank
reviews.comment_content: Several interesting topics taught through the semester, and it seems the majority of the course contents are fairly interesting and useful. The contents of the course are mainly covered in the textbook, but it seems like it is also important to take notes from professor's lecture. It is important follow the professor's teachings during class time; and thus, you must come to class everyday.
reviews.comment_teaching: It was not a bad class since the professor wanted some interactions with students. Many interactions and interesting discussions. The professor was always opened for any statements or arguments from students. The professor, indeed, checked attendance by giving out an attendance form for students to sign up. Attendance, infact, is really important as some of the contents covered in the quizzes are from professor's lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading was fairly reasonable. It seems like there is not a big difference in the group project score, and therefore I believe that it is important to get a good/high score in two quizzes.

I have received a top score for the quiz 1 and almost top score for quiz 2, and I received an A range score at the end.

- 2 Quizzes
- 5~6 Case Analysis
- Presentation for a Case analysis
- Final project report
- Final project presentation
reviews.comment_workload:
The workload of the course is quite heavy as it is 4 credits course. You have to read a case, and, based on the case, you have to write a report with your group mates. You also have to present for the case analysis. There are 2 quizzes and one final project presentation and report.

In overall, the course workload, just like other marketing courses, was heavy.

reviews.author: miffy
reviews.title: Very Good Professor, Excellent Course Materials
reviews.comment_content: Content is useful, interesting and practical. It teaches global marketing strategies in different countries and focuses on market entry and factors that you should consider. It is based on textbook, lecture notes, readings and cases.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is very good, however, she requires students to be super attentive in class, phone are not allowed in class.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair. Our group did pretty well in group project and I scored above mean in both quizzes, yet I didn't really speak a lot in class. I got a B only.
reviews.comment_workload: Very heavy workload with case write ups in every 2 weeks, 2 quizzes and project.

reviews.author: Krispy
reviews.title: Fun Course
reviews.comment_content: Very straightforward content; its basically the basic stuff you learn in your previous marketing courses but more in-depth and on a global level. Content includes: Selection of country market, country market analysis, brand positioning, standardization or adaptation in the foreign market, types of market entry strategies, and promotional strategies for the foreign market. The content is very useful and you have to be able to apply what you've learnt to your group project. Choose a company and market wisely as it will really affect your country analysis & marketing strategies.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Valenzuela is a really nice Spanish lady who is passionate about what she teaches. You can tell that she really cares about her students and wants you to do well. She may call on you randomly to check if you've paid attention, so make sure you stay awake in her class. Her lectures aren't boring and she gives very good examples for her concepts. She also fast at replying emails.
reviews.comment_grading: You'll do well if you talk a lot in class. She remembers peoples' names if they talk a lot and will give them a good participation grade. Its a good sign if she remembers your name. It is fairly easy to score above mean in her exams & case analysis write-ups. I scored above mean for all the assignments and actively participated in class discussions; managed to get an A grade in the end.
reviews.comment_workload: Average workload. You'll have to do 5 case write-ups (as a group) and 1 presentation on one of the cases. Its fairly straightforward. Also, you'll have a group project where you'll have to choose a company and decide on a foreign market to enter & come up with a marketing strategy. Choose a company that you like as you'll be working on it for the semester. You'll need to do a final report and presentation on your country market analysis and proposed market entry strategy.

reviews.author: Connie Zeng
reviews.title: Bad Grade Course
reviews.comment_content: Very vague of content, Professor was just simply walking you through the PowerPoint once. It is all about the global brands, not very interesting. Sometimes we have case discussion every week and in-class group exercise regarding the case.
reviews.comment_teaching:
He has very strong European accent, so sometimes it is difficult to understand what he is talking about. He just simply followed the PowerPoint and read it through once. For case study, he won't explain what is happening in the case, just ask you to form group to do in class group work.
Basically, he just talks many factual things during class.
reviews.comment_grading:
My total score is 81.5% =>B, cut off for a B+ is 83%. Absolute grading is used, instead of curving the performance of students.

My group mate got a C+ even though she scored 76.6% in total score.

Participation in Class worth 18% of your total class, so answer questions more often in class.
reviews.comment_workload:
Every week, you have to do a simulation game of a toothpaste company. You have to decide which market to enter, how to price your product, what your marketing and advertising strategies are, how many SKU you should launch in the market entered. Every month, you have to submit a written report in group, some based on the simulation game, some based on other topics.

There are in-class group work too, accounts for 15%. There will be case study every week, read it before class and he will briefly go through about it. Then, you will be asked to form groups to do in class exercise. Remember to submit to the TA to count your attendance and group work marks.
